abstract.original_text: Objectives: To describe the strengths and limitations of the available influenza diagnostics, with a focus on rapid antigen detection assays and nucleic acid detection assays.

sentences.segment_text: Objectives : To describe the strengths and limitations of the available influenza diagnostics ,
with a focus on rapid antigen detection assays and nucleic acid detection assays .

abstract.original_text: Methods: A case-based presentation is used to illustrate the potential limitations of rapid antigen detection assays for influenza.

sentences.segment_text: Methods : A case-based presentation is used to illustrate the potential limitations of rapid antigen detection assays for influenza .

abstract.original_text: • What is the clinical utility of influenza testing? • Is a negative influenza rapid antigen assay result a reliable way to rule out disease?

sentences.segment_text: • What is the clinical utility of influenza testing ?
• Is a negative influenza rapid antigen assay result a reliable way to rule out disease ?
